intro: Paspalidium inaequale, commonly known as the unequal paspalum, is a grass species native to South America. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in wetland and marshy environments, often forming dense mats. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
